text.p: A classy 74th minute goal by Andreas Herzog gave Austria a 2-1 victory over 10-man Latvia in a World Cup qualifier on Saturday.
Herzog, easily the best player on view, thundered a shot past goalkeeper Olegs Karavajevs from the left side of the box to send his team top of European group four.
They are one point clear of Sweden, who play away to Scotland on Sunday. Austria surprised Sweden 1-0 last month in Stockholm.
Anton Polster put Austria ahead on Saturday with a record 35th goal for his national side, tapping home a 43rd minute corner.
But the home fans' joy was short-lived with Vits Rimkus making the most of a goalkeeping mistake to grab an equaliser on the stroke of halftime.
Seventeen minutes into the second half Latvia lost defender Igors Stepanovs after a second yellow card offence. Werder Bremen's Herzog sealed the issue just 12 minutes later.
"We should have decided the match a lot earlier because we were the stronger side," said Herzog. "But we relaxed too much after scoring the first goal."

Austria: Michael Konsel, Goran Kartalija, Peter Schoettel, Anton Pfeffer, Markus Schopp, Peter Stoeger (Dieter Ramusch 60th), Adi Huetter (Dietmar Kuehbauer 60th), Andres Heraf, Arnold Wetl, Andreas Herzog, Anton Polster.

Latvia: Olegs Karavajevs, Igors Stepanovs (red card 62nd), Igors Troickis, Jurijs Sevjakovs, Imants Bleidelis, Mihails Zemlinskis, Andrejs Stolcers, Vitalijs Astafjevs, Valerijs Ivanovs, Vits Rimkus, Vladimirs Babicevs (Marians Pahars 65th).
